description:
Passionate about precision medicine and advancing the healthcare industry?

Recent advancements in underlying technology have finally made it possible for AI to impact clinical care in a meaningful way. Tempus' proprietary platform connects an entire ecosystem of real-world evidence to deliver real-time, actionable insights to physicians, providing critical information about the right treatments for the right patients, at the right time.

These insights are also experimentally evaluated in our state-of-the-art Biological Modeling Laboratory to accelerate the development of new therapeutic options for patients. We are seeking a Director/Senior Director of Business Development to lead the sales growth of our modeling laboratory services.

What You’ll Do:
• Expand Tempus footprint into pharma and biotech, interfacing with internal and external teams to drive revenue and expanded growth in organoid modeling and other functional genomics modalities
• Sell and contract new projects with customers with limited supervision in a quota-driven environment
• Interface with internal Tempus teams, including marketing, leadership, scientists, and technicians to develop novel 3D organoid models, including high throughput high content imaging assays
• Build upon an existing framework to continuously improve organoid and other patient-derived model-based research
• Drive strategic thinking to create best-in-class organoid and functional genomics platforms
• Engage with commercial and academic strategic partners to create next-gen models representing current unmet needs and indications in oncology
• Collaborate with engineers, computational biologists, data scientists, and machine learning scientists on R&D initiatives both internally and with our pharma partners

Qualifications:
• 5+ years in a fast-paced sales environment with a focus on NGS, oncology, or biomarker technologies
• Demonstrated expertise in tumor modeling, biomarker strategy, and oncology therapy development
• History of meeting and exceeding sales targets and quotas
• Experience with both internal and external projects involving multidisciplinary teams or collaborations

Preferred Candidates will Possess:
• Hands-on experience developing novel protocols, assays, and onboarding new screening technologies including tissue biomarker techniques, cell imaging, 3D cell culture assays, or organoids
• Majority of industrial experience within a drug discovery, CRO services, or technology provider setting
• BS/MS and preferred PhD in Biology
• Ability to function in a fast-paced, cross-functional team environment
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Ability to clearly present and demonstrate Tempus capabilities to cross-functional groups in both small and large formats

#LI-GL1

#LI-Hybrid

#LI-Remote
